intro: Megistostigma glabratum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed moss, is a rare and delicate species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and dark green, glossy leaves that are typically short and narrow. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocky substrates or in forest floors. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are small and clustered, contributing to its unique ecological niche. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
